channel.title: 2 worlds
channel.description:
can someone explain how to make 2 worlds. i want it like near reality where you can play on same account, for each world. but i only want 2 worlds but i want it the same server. but tell me in best way on how to do this.
^ dont under stand that heres redneck terms... - i want multi worlds like near reality. but only 2 worlds.. how do i do it?

item.title: 2 worlds
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

The point of having multiple servers on multiple hosts is so 1, you lower your costs. Why would you buy a vps with higher specs, when you can buy two lower grade vps’s for less money… 2, what if you get DOS or DDOS having both both servers on the same host with be taken down faster then having them on multiple hosts.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 worlds
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:22, topic:443291”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=545981.msg4002520#msg4002520 date=1338221833]
But with one server, that can hold more than 4k players, you can host 2 worlds imbedded inside, of course with some restrictions of each player in different worlds talking to each other. That would be stupid to run multiple servers though, cause then you would be using 2x much as CPU and memory, when you can just have it all as one, but obviously it has to be stable enough
[/quote]

What do you mean 2x as much CPU and memory… Running the worlds on a single host will cost you far more then running on multiple hosts that are lower grade… I don’t see why you would waste your money on a big dedicated server with 16 cores and 32gbs of ram to host a few worlds, when if your server is good enough to run on a duo or quad core with a few gbs of ram which would cost you far less then having to buy a bunch of pre build dedicated servers, unless you want to buy everything and then buy space at a data center…[/quote]
Why would you go through the trouble of buying multiple vps’s to run multiple servers? It would 2x as much CPU & memory if your running two servers on one VPS.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 worlds
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:19, topic:443291”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=545981.msg4002504#msg4002504 date=1338220335]

How would it take a long time… All you’re doing is having the login server handle data between the servers and then between players like private messaging and showing their current world…

The Mysql part shouldn’t be that hard either… Most servers today come with Mysql support already like forum integration, all you would need to do is use that with the login server to check passwords, usernames, world id, and have it handle private messaging… As far as I know that’s all the login server does…

Apparently… you are obsessed with using more than one period to end a sentence… as if you are rambling and pausing in real life, and you can’t go back and change what you typed… And it does take a rather long amount of time, probably 3-5 hours… which is a long time if it’s not your server you’re working on…

Why would he have to use sql
He can create two servers on different ports and still use textfiles or whatever he is using right now?

Then what the hell is the point of having two servers? That’s just like having one with two groundlevels. An equal amount of lag.
The point of multiple servers is [usually] to reduce lag on the first one.

Not sure why I have so many periods, like it even matters I can put as many of them as I wish, so get the fuck over your self.

Also the point of multiple servers isn’t to reduce lag… I have no clue who came up with such a stupid idea as that. The point of multiple servers is pretty obvious since with Multiple servers you can have more players instead of your max being 2000 players, you can have 4000 or 50000 players.

have world 1 on height level 0 and world 2 on height level 4 boom problem solved 4now

Stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.

You actually read it, and didn’t hear it. It could be the smartest thing you ever read, if you devised a lag-free server the proper way.

That is stupid, why would you have the 2 worlds hosted on a single computer. If you set up the login server and use Mysql you can have then buy lower spec computers to host the game worlds or even set up a cloud of computers.
[/quote]
You can have 4000 or 5000 players on one server, if you do it correctly. However most people can’t because 4000-5000 players causes lag, so multiple servers = reduce lag[/quote]

You would have to do client hacking for the 4000 - 5000 players which is stupid to do when the limit is their for a reason, so multiple servers doesn’t equal reduced lag, what it does equal is more money wasted on a higher spec computer since most fucktards that host think you need a 16 core box with 32 gbs of ram to host. When if you did things right you would only really need either a duo or quad with a few gbs of ram, or even you could set up a cloud with multiple higher grade boxes and then host them that way…

Read full topic

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:18, topic:443291”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=545981.msg4002457#msg4002457 date=1338216381]

How would it take a long time… All you’re doing is having the login server handle data between the servers and then between players like private messaging and showing their current world…

The Mysql part shouldn’t be that hard either… Most servers today come with Mysql support already like forum integration, all you would need to do is use that with the login server to check passwords, usernames, world id, and have it handle private messaging… As far as I know that’s all the login server does…

Apparently… you are obsessed with using more than one period to end a sentence… as if you are rambling and pausing in real life, and you can’t go back and change what you typed… And it does take a rather long amount of time, probably 3-5 hours… which is a long time if it’s not your server you’re working on…

Why would he have to use sql
He can create two servers on different ports and still use textfiles or whatever he is using right now?

Then what the hell is the point of having two servers? That’s just like having one with two groundlevels. An equal amount of lag.
The point of multiple servers is [usually] to reduce lag on the first one.
[/quote]

Not sure why I have so many periods, like it even matters I can put as many of them as I wish, so get the fuck over your self.

Also the point of multiple servers isn’t to reduce lag… I have no clue who came up with such a stupid idea as that. The point of multiple servers is pretty obvious since with Multiple servers you can have more players instead of your max being 2000 players, you can have 4000 or 50000 players.

have world 1 on height level 0 and world 2 on height level 4 boom problem solved 4now

Stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.

You actually read it, and didn’t hear it. It could be the smartest thing you ever read, if you devised a lag-free server the proper way.

That is stupid, why would you have the 2 worlds hosted on a single computer. If you set up the login server and use Mysql you can have then buy lower spec computers to host the game worlds or even set up a cloud of computers.[/quote]
You can have 4000 or 5000 players on one server, if you do it correctly. However most people can’t because 4000-5000 players causes lag, so multiple servers = reduce lag

Read full topic
